private_information: I arrive at Sunset District at 09:00 AM
I want to meet as many friends as possible during my day in San Francisco
I can travel between Sunset District and Haight-Ashbury; travel time is 15 minutes each way
traveler.goal: Maximize the number of friends met while satisfying any time-window constraints, in particular meeting Nancy as required.

private_information: I will be at Haight-Ashbury from 19:30 to 21:45
I expect a minimum meeting duration of 75 minutes with the traveler
My location while available is Haight-Ashbury
nancy.goal: Meet the traveler at Haight-Ashbury for at least 75 minutes within my availability window.

orchestrator.goal: Produce a planning problem and domain (PDDL) suitable for FastDownward that integrates agents' information and finds schedules that meet constraints and optimize the traveler's objective.

public_information: Travel times (minutes): Sunset District to Haight-Ashbury: 15, Haight-Ashbury to Sunset District: 15
You arrive in Sunset District at 09:00
Nancy will be at Haight-Ashbury from 19:30 to 21:45 and requires a minimum meeting of 75 minutes
The objective is to consider different schedules and pick the best one to maximize meetings while honoring time windows and travel times

schedule_preferences.system_prompt: You are the traveler agent. Provide your personal scheduling preferences, any known constraints on your availability, your start location and time, and priorities for meeting friends. Do not emit PDDL. Structure the response to include your earliest and latest available times, travel capability, and any ranking of friends to meet.

availability.system_prompt: You are Nancy's agent. Provide Nancy's availability window, exact location while available, the minimum meeting duration required, and any flexibility in location or time. Do not emit PDDL. Provide clear time-window and duration constraints.

pddl.system_prompt: You are the orchestrator. Collect the structured information from the traveler and Nancy. Integrate public travel times and constraints. Produce a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem that encodes locations, travel durations, agent-specific availability windows, and an objective to maximize meetings while ensuring Nancy is met for at least 75 minutes within her window. The PDDL must be suitable to solve with the FastDownward planner. Keep distinct actions or predicates that correspond to traveler movements and meeting actions. Output a single string that contains the PDDL domain enclosed between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem enclosed between <problem></problem> tags.
pddl.prompt: You will receive the following structured inputs from agents and the environment. Integrate them into a single multi-agent planning PDDL (with actions kept distinct for traveler movement and meeting) aimed at FastDownward. Inputs: {traveler_info}, {nancy_info}, public information: {environment->public_information}. Produce a PDDL domain and PDDL problem. Make no unstated assumptions beyond the provided information; if something is unspecified, encode it as unknown but allow the planner to reason with the given constraints. Enclose the domain in <domain> tags and the problem in <problem> tags.
